results.title: Butch minds the baby
results.creator_credit: Peter Webb, Adrian Hughes and Park Village Productions
results.brief_description: A humorous film based on a short story by Damon Runyon and told through voice-over narration. This film is set in Manhattan in the summer of 1931 when the unemployment situation drives a bunch of hoodlums to approach famous safe-cracker Big Butch with a plan: if he carries out a job they have arranged, they will split the payoff. Butch foresees just one complication, his wife is away for the evening and he is babysitting John Ignatius Jnr.

results.title: Bull ant warriors
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Study of the chemistry and behaviour of the Australian Red Bull Ant being undertaken by a research team in which a colony of ants is re-established in the laboratory under controlled conditions. Using close-up photography, dissection techniques and behavioural experiments research is undertaken in developing methods of control by other than chemical means. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Building Lindy's house
results.brief_description: Illustrates the selection of a block of land suitable for building a home. Shows the specialised work of different tradesmen employed in building a house and points out how the different building processes are co-ordinated.

results.title: Brothers Manakia - Pioneers of Greek and Balkan Cinema
results.brief_description: This film traces the history of Yannis and Miltos Manakia, beginning at their place of birth, the Macedonian village of Abdela, where the first Greek film “The Weavers” was made by the Manakia brothers in 1905, laying the foundations of the Greek and Balkan Cinema.

results.title: Broad shots
results.brief_description: Broad Shots was made by a group of young women from Broadmeadows as part of the Broadmeadows Healthy Localities Project, a local youth health promotion project. It looks at the issue of violence against young women through a series of interviews, skits and voxpops. “Broad Shots” is funny and fast and is a good starting point for discussion on domestic violence, sexual harassment and assertiveness. It is targeted at young people aged 13 to 16 years. Also contains appearances by comediennes Judith Lucy and Magda Szubanski.

results.title: Relays
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Training film produced in collaboration with the US Olympic Association and the Amateur Athletics Union. Techniques to improve relay team’s performance. Looks at the responsibilities of the relay members, different types of baton passes, fixed and running starts. Narrated by Bill Slater.

results.title: Javelin
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
A demonstration of the four-stage catapult throw, the preliminary run, the concluding stride, the throwing stance, and other useful points about the technique of the javelin throw.
